abstract: Agreement to fairly share water from Nile and peacefully resolve any related disputes is signed by Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan, alleviating concerns raised by Ethiopia's massive hydro-electric dam project.
lead_paragraph: The dam had been an issue of contention among the countries, with Egypt concerned it would reduce its share of the Nile established under a colonial-era agreement.

headline.main: Sudan: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan Sign Deal on Water Sharing
headline.print_headline: Africa; Sudan: Three Nations Sign Deal on Water Sharing

snippet: The dam had been an issue of contention among the countries, with Egypt concerned it would reduce its share of the Nile established under a colonial-era agreement.
